Appearance
From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

English

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From murmur +‎ -er.

Noun

[edit]

murmurer (plural murmurers)

  1. One who murmurs
    • 2007 March 17, Kelefa Sanneh, “An R&B Star Who Doesn’t Look Like One”, in New York Times‎[1]:
      […] in a genre dominated by loud beats and wailing pleas, Mr. Thicke is a hard-core murmurer.

Translations

[edit]
one who murmurs
  • Greek:
    Ancient: γογγυστής m (gongustḗs)

Anagrams

[edit]
  • remurmur

French

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Old French murmurer, borrowed from Latin murmurāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /myʁ.my.ʁe/
  • Audio:(file)
  • Audio (Switzerland (Valais)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Vosges)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Lyon)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Somain)):(file)

Verb

[edit]

murmurer

  1. to murmur

1 The French gerund is usable only with the preposition en.
2 In less formal writing or speech, these tenses may be found to have been replaced in the following way:
past historic → present perfect
past anterior → pluperfect
imperfect subjunctive → present subjunctive
pluperfect subjunctive → past subjunctive

(Christopher Kendris [1995], Master the Basics: French, pp. 77, 78, 79, 81).

Related terms

[edit]
  • marmonner
  • murmure m

Further reading

[edit]
  • “murmurer”, in Trésor de la langue française informatisé [Digitized Treasury of the French Language], 2012.

Latin

[edit]

Verb

[edit]

murmurer

  1. first-person singular present passive subjunctive of murmurō

Old French

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin murmuro, murmurare.

Verb

[edit]

murmurer

  1. to whisper
    • c. 1250, Rutebeuf, Ci encoumence la vie de Sainte Elyzabel, fille au roi de Hongrie:
      Mout murmurent ces chamberieres
      Her chambermaids whispered a lot

Conjugation

[edit]

This verb conjugates as a first-group verb ending in -er. Old French conjugation varies significantly by date and by region. The following conjugation should be treated as a guide.

    Conjugation of murmurer (see also Appendix:Old French verbs)
simple compound
infinitive murmurer avoir murmuré
gerund en murmurant gerund of avoir + past participle
present participle murmurant
past participle murmuré
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu il nos vos il
simple
tenses 		present murmur murmures murmure murmurons murmurez murmurent
imperfect murmuroie, murmureie, murmuroe, murmureve murmuroies, murmureies, murmuroes, murmureves murmuroit, murmureit, murmurot, murmureve murmuriiens, murmuriens murmuriiez, murmuriez murmuroient, murmureient, murmuroent, murmurevent
preterite murmurai murmuras murmura murmurames murmurastes murmurerent
future murmurerai murmureras murmurera murmurerons murmureroiz, murmurereiz, murmurerez murmureront
conditional murmureroie, murmurereie murmureroies, murmurereies murmureroit, murmurereit murmureriiens, murmureriens murmureriiez, murmureriez murmureroient, murmurereient
